title: Police find abandoned toddler 'locked in a dark room the size of a cell with just a bowl of water'
text:
Police arrested two people for child neglect after an abandoned toddler was found 'locked in a dark room with just a bowl of water'.

Officers were called to a property in Salford, Greater Manchester, after the abandoned child was discovered.

Sources said the youngster was left in a small, dark room on Bolton Road 'the size of a cell', with a bowl of water.

A toddler was found 'locked in a dark room with just a bowl of water' in Salford, Greater Manchester (pictured: Bolton Road)

The child was taken to hospital but was unhurt, and is now in the care of Salford council's children's services, it is understood.

According to witnesses, police stood guard at the scene for most of September 30, and the property was taped off by officers.

A 32-year-old man and 20-year-old woman were arrested on suspicion of child neglect, Greater Manchester Police said.

They have been released under investigation.

A force statement read: 'Police were called shortly after 10.40am on Thursday, October 3 following a report of an unaccompanied child at an address on Bolton Road.

'Officers attended and a man aged 32 and a woman aged 30 were arrested on suspicion of child neglect at the scene a short time later.

'They have been released under investigation.

'The child was uninjured and is in the care of children's services.

'Enquiries are ongoing.'
